org.raistlic.common.adt

Class BitMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.raistlic.common.adt.BitMap

  • public abstract class BitMap
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements the "binary rank and select" algorithm.

    The instance of the class is guaranteed to be immutable.

    That is, given a sequence of binary values (1/0), this class helps to quickly perform "rank" and "select" operations.

    A rank operation is: count the number of 1s (or 0s) up to index i A select operation is: get the index of the i-th 1 (or 0)

    The theoretical efficiency of the original algorithm is constant time operations, using multiple levels of cached maps, while this implementation caches only one level map of every 8 bits.

    Since:
    1.0

    • Method Detail

      • newInstance

        public static <E> BitMap newInstance(java.util.List<E> list,
                                     java.util.function.Predicate<? super E> condition)
        A static factory method, which is a shortcut comparing with constructing an instance using a BitMap.Builder.

        The method will iterate throw the given List, with the given Condition, and set 1s at where ever the element on the corresponding index matches the condition.

        Type Parameters:
        E - the reference type here is just to make sure, at compile time, that the given Condition instance is capable of checking the elements in the given List.
        Parameters:
        list - the list of elements based on which to create the bit map.
        condition - the condition to check the list
        Returns:
        the created bit map.

      • builder

        public static BitMap.Builder builder(int size)
        The static factory method exports a Builder instance, which provides a more flexible way of creating a BitMap instance.

        A Builder is needed mainly because the BitMap instance is immutable itself, and the Builder provides the missing "setter" methods, before a BitMap instance is created.

        As you may expect, a Builder instance is NOT thread safe.

        Parameters:
        size - the size of the bit map to build, cannot be less than 0 .
        Returns:
        the new BitMap.Builder instance.
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterException - if size is less than 0.

      • size

        public abstract int size()
        The method returns the size of the BitMap .
        Returns:
        the size of the BitMap .

      • rankOne

        public abstract int rankOne(int index)
        The method returns the number of 1 s up to index (inclusively).
        Parameters:
        index - the index up to which to query the number of 1 s, must be within the range [0, size()) .
        Returns:
        the number of 1 s.
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterException - if index is out of range.

      • rankZero

        public abstract int rankZero(int index)
        The method returns the number of 0 s up to the index (inclusively).
        Parameters:
        index - the index up to which to query the number of 0 s, must be within the range [0, size()) .
        Returns:
        the number of 0 s.
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterException - if index is out of range.

      • selectOne

        public abstract int selectOne(int i)
        The method returns the index of the i-th 1 .
        Parameters:
        i - specifies which 1 's index to query, cannot be less than 0 .
        Returns:
        the index of the i-th 1, or -1 if there are insufficient 1 s in the bit map.
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterException - if i is less than 0.

      • selectZero

        public abstract int selectZero(int i)
        The method returns the index of the i-th 0 .
        Parameters:
        i - specifies which 0 's index to query, cannot be less than 0 .
        Returns:
        the index of the i-th 0, or -1 if there are insufficient 1 s in the bit map.
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterException - if i is less than 0.

      • isOne

        public abstract boolean isOne(int index)
        The method returns whether the specified bit at index is 1 or not.
        Parameters:
        index - the index to query, must be within the range [0, size()) .
        Returns:
        true if the bit at index is 1 .
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterException - if index is out of range.
